The ultimate sage extends compassion, illuminates the faculties, and responds with traces, opening the way for the six destinies and universally saving the ten directions,
following circumstances to rise and sink, adapting to conditions to be pure or defiled. This is the skillful means to guide and attract, leading to bodhi.

Therefore, the greatly enlightened AmitÄbha, by the power of his ancient vows, manifested a form in the Land of Ultimate Bliss and presently abides in the place of enlightenment. Those who vow to be born in the three grades all enter the definite assembly. The appearance is exceptionally excellent, and the lifespan is inconceivable. The jeweled trees and heavenly flowers all expound the Dharma. The gentle breeze and flowing water both speak the wonderful sounds. Hearing the chanting of suffering and emptiness, one realizes the acceptance of non-arising.

The original vow of the Sage Lord Shakyamuni is vast and profound, not abandoning compassion, transforming this defiled realm where the five pains burn and the eight sufferings oppress, extensively clarifying admonitions and exhortations, universally benefiting all beings, demonstrating the wonderful method of going to the Pure Land in the West through ten recitations, the fourfold assembly respectfully practicing in accordance with the teachings and cultivating contemplation, speaking of the extensive and concise, the different times and places, Mount Gridhrakuta proclaiming the three kinds of pure practices, and Shravasti expounding the six directions' protection and remembrance.
Amitabha is the Indian Sanskrit, translated into Chinese as Infinite Life, the ultimate title of the transforming master used to establish the auspicious name.
Sutra is defined as eternal, spoken by the mouth of the Sage, this is what Shakyamuni spoke, speaking of the matters of the Western Pure Land, thus it is called a sutra.
This very teaching, although brief in text, the meaning is actually extensive, generally speaking of the land of peace and happiness in the West.
The first is explaining the name, taking the person as the title, relying on the teaching to cultivate and practice, and being reborn in that land.

Fifth, the characteristics of the teachings, the teachings of raw and mature pure cream, which are inclusive of the distinct and the inclusive, are taken as the characteristics of the teachings as a whole.

Those Buddhas also praise Shakyamuni for being able to do difficult things, in the mixed evil five turbidities of the Saha world, for the sake of sentient beings, to speak the difficult-to-believe Dharma, and to attain enlightenment.

The five turbidities are heavy defilements in the defiled land, with greed and hatred being the turbidity of afflictions, and the five views being the turbidity of views. The two are the basis, and this is grasped to create the life that is sustained by causes. In the five aggregates, sentient beings are provisionally established.
